trans-unit.source: Defines configuration settings to support the infrastructure for configuring and managing membership details.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection> class provides a way to programmatically access and modify the `membership` section in a configuration file.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection.%23ctor%2A> constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code.
It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system.
You obtain an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection> class by using the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.GetSection%2A> method.
Gets or sets the name of the default provider that is used to manage roles.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection.DefaultProvider%2A> must match a named value in the `providers` subsection of the `membership` section of the configuration file.
An empty string (`""`) is not a valid value for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection.DefaultProvider%2A> property.
The name of a provider in <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection.Providers"></xref>.
The default is `AspNetSqlRoleProvider`.
Gets or sets the type of encryption that is used for sensitive membership information.
At run time, the membership system binds to the appropriate hash algorithm type, and then uses this type when encrypting membership information.

If the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection.HashAlgorithmType%2A> property is not set, the membership system defaults to the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MachineKeySection.Validation%2A> property within the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MachineKeySection> class.
The type of encryption used to encrypt sensitive membership information.
Gets a <xref href="System.Configuration.ProviderSettingsCollection"></xref> object of <xref href="System.Configuration.ProviderSettings"></xref> objects.
Membership providers are components that provide access to the membership for a site.
You can specify membership providers in the `providers` subsection of the `membership` section of the configuration file.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection.DefaultProvider%2A> property contains the name of the provider that is used by default.

A <xref href="System.Configuration.ProviderSettingsCollection"></xref> that contains the provider's settings, defined within the `providers` subsection of the `membership` section of the configuration file.
Gets or sets the length of time, in minutes, before a user is no longer considered to be online.

The value for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection.UserIsOnlineTimeWindow%2A> property is calculated by comparing the current time minus the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection.UserIsOnlineTimeWindow%2A> property with the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUser.LastActivityDate%2A> value for the user.
A length of time in minutes.
